page.title: 07THE NEW ROAD & LOUISA CENTRE
page.content: In 1979 a new road was built from Stanley to Chester-le-street.The road was built to attract new businesses to the area,because it connects to the A1(M) so that they can get supplies in and products out with great speed. The road was jointly funded by the EEC and DCC and cost Â£7 million to build. The Louisa Centre Stanley sports centre was opened 18/4/80.There are 2 instructors and a manager.It costs Â£5 to join for adults and Â£3 for juniors and Â£9 for a family.On average 3700 people attend the centre every week.There are 12 different sports played and in the summer there is a play scheme for children.The centre is called the Louisa becaues it was built on the pit head.In 1947 28 people were killed. It was said to be a methane gas explosion.
